intro: Kyllinga erecta var. schlechteri, commonly known as the upright spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems that are often covered with fine, grass-like leaves. It produces small, clustered spikes of white or pale pink flowers, which are typical of the Cyperaceae family. Kyllinga erecta var. schlechteri thrives in wet or moist soil conditions, often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies.
